item.title: Madeline add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Madeline add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "A day without sunshine is like, you know, night." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Madeline add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Madeline add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Madeline add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Madeline add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Madeline add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Madeline add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "A person's a person, no matter how small." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Madeline add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Today you are You, that is truer than true. There is no one alive who is Youer than You." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Madeline add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Madeline add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Madeline add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "From there to here, from here to there, funny things are everywhere!" -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Madeline add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "When beetles fight these battles in a bottle with their paddles and the bottle's on a poodle and the poodle's eating noodles... ...they call this a muddle puddle tweetle poodle beetle noodle bottle paddle battle." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Madeline add a quote by Anthony G. Oettinger
item.description: "Time flies like an arrow; fruit flies like a banana." -- Anthony G. Oettinger

item.title: Madeline add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "From the moment I picked your book up until I laid it down, I convulsed with laughter. Someday I intend on reading it." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Madeline add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I never forget a face, but in your case I'll be glad to make an exception." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Madeline add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description:
"Room service? Send up a larger room."
[<i>A Night at the Opera</i>]" -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Madeline add a quote by mandy moore "a walk to rember"
item.description: "her love is like the wind... you cant see it... but you can feel it" -- mandy moore "a walk to rember"

item.title: Madeline add a quote by Judy Garland
item.description: "Always be a first rate version of yourself and not a second rate version of someone else." -- Judy Garland

item.title: Madeline add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Madeline add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "When you're in jail, a good friend will be trying to bail you out. A best friend will be in the cell next to you saying, 'Damn, that was fun'." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Madeline add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "One morning I shot an elephant in my pajamas. How he got in my pajamas I'll never know." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Madeline add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best." -- Marilyn Monroe
